This should ensure  that the following stylesheet processing instruction is honored by  these new browser versions. For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Economics</title>   <subtitle>One of Europe's premier teaching and research schools, the School of Economics has attained the highest possible score for teaching quality and is ranked third in the UK for the quality and volume of its research by the 2008 Research Assessment Exercise.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-13T00:10:02Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Economics BA/BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/ba-bsc-economics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Microeconomics, macroeconomics, mathematics and statistics form the core of this degree, around which you study modules in a wide range of topics. The maths and statistics components of the degree are available as either econometrics or quantitative economics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:04:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-01-07T16:03:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/ba-bsc-economics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Philosophy, Politics and Economics BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/philosophy-politics-and-economics-ba.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This is a multidisciplinary course which is made up of 35% Economics, 33% Philosophy and 32% Politics.</summary>     <published>2014-10-03T12:29:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-10-03T12:10:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/philosophy-politics-and-economics-ba.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics with Chinese Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-chinese.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>China is a major power in international business and knowledge of contemporary China and the Mandarin language are skills highly sought-after by many employers. Economics modules form two-thirds of the degree and the remainder is made up of modules in Chinese studies.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-01-07T16:10:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-chinese.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics and Econometrics BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-econometrics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This course offers a rigorous analysis of advanced mathematical and statistical methods used in economics. Compulsory modules in econometrics form part of all three years of the degree; however, there is the opportunity to take modules outside the School in year one.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:56:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-01-07T16:12:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-econometrics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics with French BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-french.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The aim of these degrees is to produce high-quality economic analysts who are fluent in a language, rather than linguists with some training in economics. As a result, you will study the same core economics modules as those taking BA (Hons) Economics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-01-07T16:15:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-french.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics with German BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-german.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The aim of these degrees is to produce high-quality economic analysts who are fluent in a language, rather than linguists with some training in economics. As a result, you will study the same core economics modules as those taking BA (Hons) Economics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-07T15:41:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-german.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics with Hispanic Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-hispanic.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The aim of these degrees is to produce high-quality economic analysts who are fluent in a language, rather than linguists with some training in economics. As a result, you will study the same core economics modules as those taking BA (Hons) Economics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-07T15:44:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-hispanic.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics and International Economics BA/BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/ba-economics-international-economics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This course is particularly well-suited to students who wish to study international trade and international aspects of financial economics. Modules in International Economics form a significant element of this course.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:05:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-01-07T16:05:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/ba-economics-international-economics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics and Philosophy BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-philosophy.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Zoe Haslam</name>     </author>     <summary>Both economics and philosophy look at fundamental aspects of human society. The combination allows a deeper understanding of how societies work and the course will provide a unique blend of knowledge from the two disciplines.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-08-29T09:38:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-philosophy.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics with Russian BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-russian.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The aim of this degree is to produce high-quality economic analysts who are fluent in a language, rather than linguists with some training in economics. As a result, you will study the same core economics modules as those taking BA (Hons) Economics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-07T15:45:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-russian.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
